CAEN/CAENDigitizer/CAENDigitizer_2.3.2/samples/ReadoutTest_DPP_PSD_x720/src/ReadoutTest_DPP_PSD_x720.c

00002 *

00017 #include <CAENDigitizer.h>
00018 
00019 #include <stdio.h>
00020 #include <stdlib.h>
00021 
00022 //#define MANUAL_BUFFER_SETTING   0
00023 // The following define must be set to the actual number of connected boards
00024 #define MAXNB   1
00025 // NB: the following define MUST specify the ACTUAL max allowed number of board's channels
00026 // it is needed for consistency inside the CAENDigitizer's functions used to allocate the memory
00027 #define MaxNChannels 8
00028 
00029 #define MAXNBITS 12
00030 
00031 /* include some useful functions from file Functions.h
00032 you can find this file in the src directory */
00033 #include "Functions.h"
00034 
00035 /* ###########################################################################
00036 *  Functions
00037 *  ########################################################################### */

00039 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00043 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00044 int ProgramDigitizer(int handle, DigitizerParams_t Params, CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_Params_t DPPParams)
00045 {
00046     /* This function uses the CAENDigitizer API functions to perform the digitizer's initial configuration */
00047     int i, ret = 0;
00048 
00049     /* Reset the digitizer */
00050     ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_Reset(handle);
00051 
00052     if (ret) {
00053         printf("ERROR: can't reset the digitizer.\n");
00054         return -1;
00055     }
00056 
00057     /* Set the DPP acquisition mode
00058     This setting affects the modes Mixed and List (see CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_AcqMode_t definition for details)
00059     CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_SAVE_PARAM_EnergyOnly        Only energy (DPP-PHA) or charge (DPP-PSD/DPP-CI v2) is returned
00060     CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_SAVE_PARAM_TimeOnly        Only time is returned
00061     CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_SAVE_PARAM_EnergyAndTime    Both energy/charge and time are returned
00062     CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_SAVE_PARAM_None            No histogram data is returned */
00063     ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_SetDPPAcquisitionMode(handle, Params.AcqMode, CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_SAVE_PARAM_EnergyAndTime);
00064     
00065     // Set the digitizer acquisition mode (CAEN_DGTZ_SW_CONTROLLED or CAEN_DGTZ_S_IN_CONTROLLED)
00066     ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_SetAcquisitionMode(handle, CAEN_DGTZ_SW_CONTROLLED);
00067 
00068     // Set the I/O level (CAEN_DGTZ_IOLevel_NIM or CAEN_DGTZ_IOLevel_TTL)
00069     ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_SetIOLevel(handle, Params.IOlev);
00070 
00071     /* Set the digitizer's behaviour when an external trigger arrives:
00072 
00073     CAEN_DGTZ_TRGMODE_DISABLED: do nothing
00074     CAEN_DGTZ_TRGMODE_EXTOUT_ONLY: generate the Trigger Output signal
00075     CAEN_DGTZ_TRGMODE_ACQ_ONLY = generate acquisition trigger
00076     CAEN_DGTZ_TRGMODE_ACQ_AND_EXTOUT = generate both Trigger Output and acquisition trigger
00077 
00078     see CAENDigitizer user manual, chapter "Trigger configuration" for details */
00079     ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_SetExtTriggerInputMode(handle, CAEN_DGTZ_TRGMODE_ACQ_ONLY);
00080 
00081     // Set the enabled channels
00082     ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_SetChannelEnableMask(handle, Params.ChannelMask);
00083 
00084     // Set how many events to accumulate in the board memory before being available for readout
00085     ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_SetDPPEventAggregation(handle, Params.EventAggr, 0);
00086     
00087     /* Set the mode used to syncronize the acquisition between different boards.
00088     In this example the sync is disabled */
00089     ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_SetRunSynchronizationMode(handle, CAEN_DGTZ_RUN_SYNC_Disabled);
00090     
00091     // Set the DPP specific parameters for the channels in the given channelMask
00092     ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_SetDPPParameters(handle, Params.ChannelMask, &DPPParams);
00093     
00094     for(i=0; i<MaxNChannels; i++) {
00095         if (Params.ChannelMask & (1<<i)) {
00096             // Set the number of samples for each waveform (you can set different RL for different channels)
00097             ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_SetRecordLength(handle, Params.RecordLength, i);
00098 
00099             // Set a DC offset to the input signal to adapt it to digitizer's dynamic range
00100             ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_SetChannelDCOffset(handle, i, 0x8000);
00101             
00102             // Set the Pre-Trigger size (in samples)
00103             ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_SetDPPPreTriggerSize(handle, i, 80);
00104             
00105             // Set the polarity for the given channel (CAEN_DGTZ_PulsePolarityPositive or CAEN_DGTZ_PulsePolarityNegative)
00106             ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_SetChannelPulsePolarity(handle, i, Params.PulsePolarity);
00107         }
00108     }
00109 
00110     /* Set the virtual probes
00111 
00112     DPP-PSD for x720 boards can save:
00113     2 analog waveforms:
00114         Analog Trace 1: it is always the input signal;
00115         Analog Trace 2: it can be specified with the VIRTUALPROBE parameter
00116     4 digital waveforms:
00117         Digital Trace 1:   it is always the trigger
00118         Digital Trace 2:   it is always the long gate
00119         Digital Trace 3/4: they can be specified with the DIGITALPROBE 1 and 2 parameters
00120 
00121     DPP-PSD for x751 boards can save:
00122     2 analog waveforms:
00123         Analog Trace 1: it is always the input signal;
00124         Analog Trace 2: it can be specified with the VIRTUALPROBE parameter
00125     3 digital waveforms:
00126         Digital Trace 1:   it is always the trigger
00127         Digital Trace 2/3: they can be specified with the DIGITALPROBE 1 and 2 parameters
00128 
00129     CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_VIRTUALPROBE_SINGLE    -> Save only the Input Signal waveform
00130     CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_VIRTUALPROBE_DUAL      -> Save also the waveform specified in VIRTUALPROBE
00131 
00132     Virtual Probes types for Trace 2:
00133         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_VIRTUALPROBE_Baseline         -> Save the Baseline waveform (mean on nsbl parameter)
00134       ### Virtual Probes only for FW <= 13X.5 ###
00135         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_VIRTUALPROBE_Threshold        -> Save the (Baseline - Threshold) waveform. NOTE: x720 only
00136     
00137     Digital Probes types for Digital Trace 3(x720)/2(x751):
00138       ### Virtual Probes only for FW >= 13X.6 ###
00139         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_R6_ExtTrg       NOTE: x720 only
00140         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_R6_OverThr
00141         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_R6_TrigOut
00142         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_R6_CoincWin
00143         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_R6_PileUp
00144         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_R6_Coincidence
00145         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_R6_GateLong     NOTE: x751 only
00146       ### Virtual Probes only for FW <= 13X.5 ###
00147         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_Armed           NOTE: x720 only
00148         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_Trigger         NOTE: x720 only
00149         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_ChargeReady     NOTE: x720 only
00150         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_PileUp          NOTE: x720 only
00151         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_BlOutSafeBand   NOTE: x720 only
00152         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_BlTimeout       NOTE: x720 only
00153         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_CoincidenceMet  NOTE: x720 only
00154         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_Tvaw            NOTE: x720 only
00155         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_OverThr             NOTE: x751 only
00156         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_GateShort               NOTE: x751 only
00157         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_None            NOTE: x751 only
00158 
00159     Digital Probes types for Digital Trace 4(x720)/3(x751):
00160       ### Virtual Probes only for FW >= 13X.6 ###
00161         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_R6_GateShort
00162         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_R6_OverThr
00163         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_R6_TrgVal
00164         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_R6_TrgHO
00165         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_R6_PileUp
00166         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_R6_Coincidence
00167       ### Virtual Probes only for FW <= 13X.5 ###
00168         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_Armed           NOTE: x720 only
00169             CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_Trigger         NOTE: x720 only
00170             CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_ChargeReady     NOTE: x720 only
00171             CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_PileUp          NOTE: x720 only
00172             CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_BlOutSafeBand   NOTE: x720 only
00173             CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_BlTimeout       NOTE: x720 only
00174             CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_CoincidenceMet  NOTE: x720 only
00175             CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_Tvaw            NOTE: x720 only
00176         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_GateShort               NOTE: x751 only
00177         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_GateLong                NOTE: x751 only
00178         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_None            NOTE: x751 only */ 
00179     ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_SetDPP_PSD_VirtualProbe(handle, CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_VIRTUALPROBE_SINGLE, CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_VIRTUALPROBE_Baseline, CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE1_R6_GateLong, CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_DIGITALPROBE2_R6_OverThr);
00180 
00181     if (ret) {
00182         printf("Warning: errors found during the programming of the digitizer.\nSome settings may not be executed\n");
00183         return ret;
00184     } else {
00185         return 0;
00186     }
00187 }
00188 
00189 /* ########################################################################### */
00190 /* MAIN                                                                        */
00191 /* ########################################################################### */
00192 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00193 {
00194     /* The following variable is the type returned from most of CAENDigitizer
00195     library functions and is used to check if there was an error in function
00196     execution. For example:
00197     ret = CAEN_DGTZ_some_function(some_args);
00198     if(ret) printf("Some error"); */
00199     CAEN_DGTZ_ErrorCode ret;
00200 
00201     /* Buffers to store the data. The memory must be allocated using the appropriate
00202     CAENDigitizer API functions (see below), so they must not be initialized here
00203     NB: you must use the right type for different DPP analysis (in this case PSD) */
00204     char *buffer = NULL;                                    // readout buffer
00205     CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_Event_t       *Events[MaxNChannels];  // events buffer
00206     CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_Waveforms_t   *Waveform=NULL;         // waveforms buffer
00207 
00208     /* The following variables will store the digitizer configuration parameters */
00209     CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_Params_t DPPParams[MAXNB];
00210     DigitizerParams_t Params[MAXNB];
00211 
00212     /* Arrays for data analysis */
00213     uint64_t PrevTime[MAXNB][MaxNChannels];
00214     uint64_t ExtendedTT[MAXNB][MaxNChannels];
00215     uint32_t *EHistoShort[MAXNB][MaxNChannels];   // Energy Histograms for short gate charge integration
00216     uint32_t *EHistoLong[MAXNB][MaxNChannels];    // Energy Histograms for long gate charge integration
00217     float *EHistoRatio[MAXNB][MaxNChannels];      // Energy Histograms for ratio Long/Short
00218     int ECnt[MAXNB][MaxNChannels];                // Number-of-Entries Counter for Energy Histograms short and long gate
00219     int TrgCnt[MAXNB][MaxNChannels];
00220 
00221     /* The following variable will be used to get an handler for the digitizer. The
00222     handler will be used for most of CAENDigitizer functions to identify the board */
00223     int handle[MAXNB];
00224 
00225     /* Other variables */
00226     int i, b, ch, ev;
00227     int Quit=0;
00228     int AcqRun = 0;
00229     uint32_t AllocatedSize, BufferSize;
00230     int Nb=0;
00231     int DoSaveWave[MAXNB][MaxNChannels];
00232     int MajorNumber;
00233     int BitMask = 0;
00234     uint64_t CurrentTime, PrevRateTime, ElapsedTime;
00235     uint32_t NumEvents[MaxNChannels];
00236     CAEN_DGTZ_BoardInfo_t           BoardInfo;
00237 
00238     memset(DoSaveWave, 0, MAXNB*MaxNChannels*sizeof(int));
00239     for (i=0; i<MAXNBITS; i++)
00240         BitMask |= 1<<i; /* Create a bit mask based on number of bits of the board */
00241 
00242     /* *************************************************************************************** */
00243     /* Set Parameters                                                                          */
00244     /* *************************************************************************************** */
00245     memset(&Params, 0, MAXNB*sizeof(DigitizerParams_t));
00246     memset(&DPPParams, 0, MAXNB*sizeof(CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_Params_t));
00247     for(b=0; b<MAXNB; b++) {
00248         for(ch=0; ch<MaxNChannels; ch++) {
00249             EHistoShort[b][ch] = NULL; // Set all histograms pointers to NULL (we will allocate them later)
00250             EHistoLong[b][ch] = NULL;
00251             EHistoRatio[b][ch] = NULL;
00252         }
00253 
00254         /****************************\
00255         * Communication Parameters   *
00256         \****************************/
00257         // Direct USB connection
00258         //Params[b].LinkType = CAEN_DGTZ_USB;  // Link Type
00259         //Params[b].VMEBaseAddress = 0;  // For direct USB connection, VMEBaseAddress must be 0
00260 
00261         // Direct optical connection
00262         Params[b].LinkType = CAEN_DGTZ_PCI_OpticalLink;  // Link Type
00263         Params[b].VMEBaseAddress = 0;  // For direct CONET connection, VMEBaseAddress must be 0
00264 
00265         // Optical connection to A2818 (or A3818) and access to the board with VME bus
00266         //Params[b].LinkType = CAEN_DGTZ_PCI_OpticalLink;  // Link Type (CAEN_DGTZ_PCIE_OpticalLink for A3818)
00267         //Params[b].VMEBaseAddress = 0x32100000;  // VME Base Address (only for VME bus access; must be 0 for direct connection (CONET or USB)
00268         
00269         // USB connection to V1718 bridge and access to the board with VME bus
00270         //Params[b].LinkType = CAEN_DGTZ_USB;  // Link Type (CAEN_DGTZ_PCIE_OpticalLink for A3818)
00271         //Params[b].VMEBaseAddress = 0x32110000;  // VME Base Address (only for VME bus access; must be 0 for direct connection (CONET or USB)
00272         
00273         Params[b].IOlev = CAEN_DGTZ_IOLevel_TTL;
00274         /****************************\
00275         *  Acquisition parameters    *
00276         \****************************/
00277         Params[b].AcqMode = CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_ACQ_MODE_Mixed;          // CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_ACQ_MODE_List or CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_ACQ_MODE_Oscilloscope
00278         Params[b].RecordLength = 12;                              // Num of samples of the waveforms (only for Oscilloscope mode)
00279         Params[b].ChannelMask = 0xF;                               // Channel enable mask
00280         Params[b].EventAggr = 17554;                                  // number of events in one aggregate (0=automatic)
00281         Params[b].PulsePolarity = CAEN_DGTZ_PulsePolarityNegative; // Pulse Polarity (this parameter can be individual)
00282 
00283         /****************************\
00284         *      DPP parameters        *
00285         \****************************/
00286         for(ch=0; ch<MaxNChannels; ch++) {
00287             DPPParams[b].thr[ch] = 50;        // Trigger Threshold
00288             /* The following parameter is used to specifiy the number of samples for the baseline averaging:
00289             0 -> absolute Bl
00290             1 -> 4samp
00291             2 -> 8samp
00292             3 -> 16samp
00293             4 -> 32samp
00294             5 -> 64samp
00295             6 -> 128samp */
00296             DPPParams[b].nsbl[ch] = 2;
00297             DPPParams[b].lgate[ch] = 32;    // Long Gate Width (N*4ns)
00298             DPPParams[b].sgate[ch] = 24;    // Short Gate Width (N*4ns)
00299             DPPParams[b].pgate[ch] = 8;     // Pre Gate Width (N*4ns)
00300             /* Self Trigger Mode:
00301             0 -> Disabled
00302             1 -> Enabled */
00303             DPPParams[b].selft[ch] = 1;
00304             // Trigger configuration:
00305             // CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_TriggerConfig_Peak       -> trigger on peak. NOTE: Only for FW <= 13X.5
00306             // CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_TriggerConfig_Threshold  -> trigger on threshold */
00307             DPPParams[b].trgc[ch] = CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_TriggerConfig_Threshold;
00308             /* Trigger Validation Acquisition Window */
00309             DPPParams[b].tvaw[ch] = 50;
00310             /* Charge sensibility: 0->40fc/LSB; 1->160fc/LSB; 2->640fc/LSB; 3->2,5pc/LSB */
00311             DPPParams[b].csens[ch] = 0;
00312         }
00313         /* Pile-Up rejection Mode
00314         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_PUR_DetectOnly -> Only Detect Pile-Up
00315         CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_PUR_Enabled -> Reject Pile-Up */
00316         DPPParams[b].purh = CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_PSD_PUR_DetectOnly;
00317         DPPParams[b].purgap = 100;  // Purity Gap
00318         DPPParams[b].blthr = 3;     // Baseline Threshold
00319         DPPParams[b].bltmo = 100;   // Baseline Timeout
00320         DPPParams[b].trgho = 8;     // Trigger HoldOff
00321     }
00322 
00323     /* *************************************************************************************** */
00324     /* Open the digitizer and read board information                                           */
00325     /* *************************************************************************************** */
00326     /* The following function is used to open the digitizer with the given connection parameters
00327     and get the handler to it */
00328     for(b=0; b<MAXNB; b++) {
00329         /* IMPORTANT: The following function identifies the different boards with a system which may change
00330         for different connection methods (USB, Conet, ecc). Refer to CAENDigitizer user manual for more info.
00331         Some examples below */
00332         
00333         /* The following is for b boards connected via b USB direct links
00334         in this case you must set Params[b].LinkType = CAEN_DGTZ_USB and Params[b].VMEBaseAddress = 0 */
00335         //ret = CAEN_DGTZ_OpenDigitizer(Params[b].LinkType, b, 0, Params[b].VMEBaseAddress, &handle[b]);
00336 
00337         /* The following is for b boards connected via 1 opticalLink in dasy chain
00338         in this case you must set Params[b].LinkType = CAEN_DGTZ_PCI_OpticalLink and Params[b].VMEBaseAddress = 0 */
00339         ret = CAEN_DGTZ_OpenDigitizer(Params[b].LinkType, 0, b, Params[b].VMEBaseAddress, &handle[b]);
00340 
00341         /* The following is for b boards connected to A2818 (or A3818) via opticalLink (or USB with A1718)
00342         in this case the boards are accessed throught VME bus, and you must specify the VME address of each board:
00343         Params[b].LinkType = CAEN_DGTZ_PCI_OpticalLink (CAEN_DGTZ_PCIE_OpticalLink for A3818 or CAEN_DGTZ_USB for A1718)
00344         Params[0].VMEBaseAddress = <0xXXXXXXXX> (address of first board) 
00345         Params[1].VMEBaseAddress = <0xYYYYYYYY> (address of second board) 
00346         etc */
00347         //ret = CAEN_DGTZ_OpenDigitizer(Params[b].LinkType, 0, 0, Params[b].VMEBaseAddress, &handle[b]);
00348         if (ret) {
00349             printf("Can't open digitizer\n");
00350             goto QuitProgram;    
00351         }
00352         
00353         /* Once we have the handler to the digitizer, we use it to call the other functions */
00354         ret = CAEN_DGTZ_GetInfo(handle[b], &BoardInfo);
00355         if (ret) {
00356             printf("Can't read board info\n");
00357             goto QuitProgram;
00358         }
00359         printf("\nConnected to CAEN Digitizer Model %s, recognized as board %d\n", BoardInfo.ModelName, b);
00360         printf("ROC FPGA Release is %s\n", BoardInfo.ROC_FirmwareRel);
00361         printf("AMC FPGA Release is %s\n", BoardInfo.AMC_FirmwareRel);
00362 
00363         // Check firmware revision (only DPP firmware can be used with this Demo) */
00364         sscanf(BoardInfo.AMC_FirmwareRel, "%d", &MajorNumber);
00365         if (MajorNumber != 131 && MajorNumber != 132 ) {
00366             printf("This digitizer has not a DPP-PSD firmware\n");
00367             goto QuitProgram;
00368         }
00369     }
00370 
00371     /* *************************************************************************************** */
00372     /* Program the digitizer (see function ProgramDigitizer)                                   */
00373     /* *************************************************************************************** */
00374     for(b=0; b<MAXNB; b++) {
00375         ret = ProgramDigitizer(handle[b], Params[b], DPPParams[b]);
00376         if (ret) {
00377             printf("Failed to program the digitizer\n");
00378             goto QuitProgram;
00379         }
00380     }
00381 
00382     /* WARNING: The mallocs MUST be done after the digitizer programming,
00383     because the following functions needs to know the digitizer configuration
00384     to allocate the right memory amount */
00385     /* Allocate memory for the readout buffer */
00386     ret = CAEN_DGTZ_MallocReadoutBuffer(handle[0], &buffer, &AllocatedSize);
00387     /* Allocate memory for the events */
00388     ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_MallocDPPEvents(handle[0], Events, &AllocatedSize); 
00389     /* Allocate memory for the waveforms */
00390     ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_MallocDPPWaveforms(handle[0], &Waveform, &AllocatedSize); 
00391     if (ret) {
00392         printf("Can't allocate memory buffers\n");
00393         goto QuitProgram;    
00394     }
00395 
00396         
00397     /* *************************************************************************************** */
00398     /* Readout Loop                                                                            */
00399     /* *************************************************************************************** */
00400     // Clear Histograms and counters
00401     for(b=0; b<MAXNB; b++) {
00402         for(ch=0; ch<MaxNChannels; ch++) {
00403             // Allocate Memory for Histos and set them to 0
00404             EHistoShort[b][ch] = (uint32_t *)malloc( (1<<MAXNBITS)*sizeof(uint32_t) );
00405             memset(EHistoShort[b][ch], 0, (1<<MAXNBITS)*sizeof(uint32_t));
00406             EHistoLong[b][ch] = (uint32_t *)malloc( (1<<MAXNBITS)*sizeof(uint32_t) );
00407             memset(EHistoLong[b][ch], 0, (1<<MAXNBITS)*sizeof(uint32_t));
00408             EHistoRatio[b][ch] = (float *)malloc( (1<<MAXNBITS)*sizeof(float) );
00409             memset(EHistoRatio[b][ch], 0, (1<<MAXNBITS)*sizeof(float));
00410             TrgCnt[b][ch] = 0;
00411             ECnt[b][ch] = 0;
00412             PrevTime[b][ch] = 0;
00413             ExtendedTT[b][ch] = 0;
00414         }
00415     }
00416     PrevRateTime = get_time();
00417     AcqRun = 0;
00418     PrintInterface();
00419     printf("Type a command: ");
00420     while(!Quit) {
00421 
00422         // Check keyboard
00423         if(kbhit()) {
00424             char c;
00425             c = getch();
00426             if (c=='q')  Quit = 1;
00427             if (c=='t')
00428                 for(b=0; b<MAXNB; b++)
00429                     CAEN_DGTZ_SendSWtrigger(handle[b]); /* Send a software trigger to each board */
00430             if (c=='h')
00431                 for(b=0; b<MAXNB; b++)
00432                     for(ch=0; ch<MaxNChannels; ch++)
00433                         if( ECnt[b][ch] != 0) {
00434                             /* Save Histograms to file for each board and channel */
00435                             SaveHistogram("HistoShort", b, ch, EHistoShort[b][ch]);  
00436                             SaveHistogram("HistoLong", b, ch, EHistoLong[b][ch]);
00437                         }
00438             if (c=='w')
00439                 for(b=0; b<MAXNB; b++)
00440                     for(ch=0; ch<MaxNChannels; ch++)
00441                         DoSaveWave[b][ch] = 1; /* save waveforms to file for each channel for each board (at next trigger) */
00442             if (c=='r')  {
00443                 for(b=0; b<MAXNB; b++) {
00444                     CAEN_DGTZ_SWStopAcquisition(handle[b]); 
00445                     printf("Restarted\n");
00446                     CAEN_DGTZ_ClearData(handle[b]);
00447                     CAEN_DGTZ_SWStartAcquisition(handle[b]);
00448                 }
00449             }
00450             if (c=='s')  {
00451                 for(b=0; b<MAXNB; b++) {
00452                     // Start Acquisition
00453                     // NB: the acquisition for each board starts when the following line is executed
00454                     // so in general the acquisition does NOT starts syncronously for different boards
00455                     CAEN_DGTZ_SWStartAcquisition(handle[b]);
00456                     printf("Acquisition Started for Board %d\n", b);
00457                 }
00458                 AcqRun = 1;
00459             }
00460             if (c=='S')  {
00461                 for(b=0; b<MAXNB; b++) {
00462                     // Stop Acquisition
00463                     CAEN_DGTZ_SWStopAcquisition(handle[b]); 
00464                     printf("Acquisition Stopped for Board %d\n", b);
00465                 }
00466                 AcqRun = 0;
00467             }
00468         }
00469         if (!AcqRun) {
00470             Sleep(10);
00471             continue;
00472         }
00473     
00474         /* Calculate throughput and trigger rate (every second) */
00475         CurrentTime = get_time();
00476         ElapsedTime = CurrentTime - PrevRateTime; /* milliseconds */
00477         if (ElapsedTime > 1000) {
00478             system(CLEARSCR);
00479             PrintInterface();
00480             printf("Readout Rate=%.2f MB\n", (float)Nb/((float)ElapsedTime*1048.576f));
00481             for(b=0; b<MAXNB; b++) {
00482                 printf("\nBoard %d:\n",b);
00483                 for(i=0; i<MaxNChannels; i++) {
00484                     if (TrgCnt[b][i]>0)
00485                         printf("\tCh %d:\tTrgRate=%.2f KHz\t%\n", b*8+i, (float)TrgCnt[b][i]/(float)ElapsedTime);
00486                     else
00487                         printf("\tCh %d:\tNo Data\n", i);
00488                     TrgCnt[b][i]=0;
00489                 }
00490             }
00491             Nb = 0;
00492             PrevRateTime = CurrentTime;
00493             printf("\n\n");
00494         }
00495         
00496         /* Read data from the boards */
00497         for(b=0; b<MAXNB; b++) {
00498             /* Read data from the board */
00499             ret = CAEN_DGTZ_ReadData(handle[b], CAEN_DGTZ_SLAVE_TERMINATED_READOUT_MBLT, buffer, &BufferSize);
00500             if (ret) {
00501                 printf("Readout Error\n");
00502                 goto QuitProgram;    
00503             }
00504             if (BufferSize == 0)
00505                 continue;
00506 
00507             Nb += BufferSize;
00508             //ret = DataConsistencyCheck((uint32_t *)buffer, BufferSize/4);
00509             ret |= CAEN_DGTZ_GetDPPEvents(handle[b], buffer, BufferSize, Events, NumEvents);
00510             if (ret) {
00511                 printf("Data Error: %d\n", ret);
00512                 goto QuitProgram;
00513             }
00514 
00515             /* Analyze data */
00516             for(ch=0; ch<MaxNChannels; ch++) {
00517                 if (!(Params[b].ChannelMask & (1<<ch)))
00518                     continue;
00519                 
00520                 /* Update Histograms */
00521                 for(ev=0; ev<NumEvents[ch]; ev++) {
00522                     TrgCnt[b][ch]++;
00523                     /* Time Tag */
00524                     if (Events[ch][ev].TimeTag < PrevTime[b][ch]) 
00525                         ExtendedTT[b][ch]++;
00526                     PrevTime[b][ch] = Events[ch][ev].TimeTag;
00527                     /* Energy */
00528                     if ( (Events[ch][ev].ChargeLong > 0) && (Events[ch][ev].ChargeShort > 0)) {
00529                             // Fill the histograms
00530                             EHistoShort[b][ch][(Events[ch][ev].ChargeShort) & BitMask]++;
00531                             EHistoLong[b][ch][(Events[ch][ev].ChargeLong) & BitMask]++;
00532                             ECnt[b][ch]++;
00533                     }
00534 
00535                     /* Get Waveforms (only from 1st event in the buffer) */
00536                     if ((Params[b].AcqMode != CAEN_DGTZ_DPP_ACQ_MODE_List) && DoSaveWave[b][ch] && (ev == 0)) {
00537                         int size;
00538                         int16_t *WaveLine;
00539                         uint8_t *DigitalWaveLine;
00540                         CAEN_DGTZ_DecodeDPPWaveforms(handle[b], &Events[ch][ev], Waveform);
00541 
00542                         // Use waveform data here...
00543                         size = (int)(Waveform->Ns); // Number of samples
00544                         WaveLine = Waveform->Trace1; // First trace (for DPP-PSD it is ALWAYS the Input Signal)
00545                         SaveWaveform(b, ch, 1, size, WaveLine);
00546 
00547                         WaveLine = Waveform->Trace2; // Second Trace (if single trace mode, it is a sequence of zeroes)
00548                         SaveWaveform(b, ch, 2, size, WaveLine);
00549                         DoSaveWave[b][ch] = 0;
00550 
00551                         DigitalWaveLine = Waveform->DTrace1; // First Digital Trace (Gate Short)
00552                         SaveDigitalProbe(b, ch, 1, size, DigitalWaveLine);
00553                         DoSaveWave[b][ch] = 0;
00554 
00555                         DigitalWaveLine = Waveform->DTrace2; // Second Digital Trace (Gate Long)
00556                         SaveDigitalProbe(b, ch, 2, size, DigitalWaveLine);
00557                         DoSaveWave[b][ch] = 0;
00558 
00559                         DigitalWaveLine = Waveform->DTrace3; // Third Digital Trace (DIGITALPROBE1 set with CAEN_DGTZ_SetDPP_PSD_VirtualProbe)
00560                         SaveDigitalProbe(b, ch, 3, size, DigitalWaveLine);
00561                         DoSaveWave[b][ch] = 0;
00562 
00563                         DigitalWaveLine = Waveform->DTrace4; // Fourth Digital Trace (DIGITALPROBE2 set with CAEN_DGTZ_SetDPP_PSD_VirtualProbe)
00564                         SaveDigitalProbe(b, ch, 4, size, DigitalWaveLine);
00565                         DoSaveWave[b][ch] = 0;
00566                         printf("Waveforms saved to 'Waveform_<board>_<channel>_<trace>.txt'\n");
00567                     } // loop to save waves        
00568                 } // loop on events
00569             } // loop on channels
00570         } // loop on boards
00571     } // End of readout loop
00572 
00573 
00574 QuitProgram:
00575     /* stop the acquisition, close the device and free the buffers */
00576     for(b=0; b<MAXNB; b++) {
00577         CAEN_DGTZ_SWStopAcquisition(handle[b]);
00578         CAEN_DGTZ_CloseDigitizer(handle[b]);
00579         for (ch=0; ch<MaxNChannels; ch++) {
00580             free(EHistoShort[b][ch]);
00581             free(EHistoLong[b][ch]);
00582             free(EHistoRatio[b][ch]);
00583         }
00584     }
00585     CAEN_DGTZ_FreeReadoutBuffer(&buffer);
00586     CAEN_DGTZ_FreeDPPEvents(handle[0], Events);
00587     CAEN_DGTZ_FreeDPPWaveforms(handle[0], Waveform);
00588     return ret;
00589 }
00590
